A: 1. Highway codes are rules that help us stay _ on the roads (a) safe (b) fast (c) lost
2. Highway codes are designed to ensure safety on our roads and _ (a) homes (b) highways (c) schools
3. Before crossing the road, you should look (a) only left (b) only right (c) left, right and left again
4. To cross the road safely, you should use (a) any spot (b) designated cross-walks (c) the middle of the road
5. When walking on the road, especially as a kid, you should (a) run ahead (b) hold someone's hand (c) walk alone
6. To be visible to drivers, you should wear (a) dark colors (b) bright or reflective clothing (c) camouflage
7. What does a red traffic light mean? (a) Go (b) Stop (c) Get ready to stop
8. A green traffic light means (a) Stop (b) Go (c) Wait
9. Yellow traffic light means (a) Stop immediately (b) Go faster (c) Get ready to stop
10. Highway codes safeguard _ and property on our roads (a) money (b) animals (c) lives
11. Highway codes promote responsible and _ use of the roads (a) chaotic (b) disorderly (c) orderly
12. Highway codes guide drivers, cyclists and other _ on proper use of roads (a) pedestrians (b) road users (c) passengers
13. Reckless drivers are _ and punished due to highway codes (a) rewarded (b) ignored (c) arrested
14. A Pedestrian Crossing is also known as a _ (a) Zebra Crossing (b) Tiger Crossing (c) Lion Crossing
15. At a Pedestrian Crossing, vehicles should (a) speed up (b) stop and give way to pedestrians (c) honk loudly
16. The 'No Entry' sign informs road users they are on the _ way (a) right (b) wrong (c) fastest
17. A 'No Entry' sign can indicate that a road is _ way only (a) two (b) three (c) one
18. Security refers to safety, well-being, freedom and _ (a) war (b) peace (c) chaos
19. Security is the protection from dangers to life and _ (a) wealth (b) property (c) health
20. Without security, it is difficult to carry out economic, social, and _ activities (a) recreational (b) political (c) artistic
